files.name: versions.tf
provider.tf
variables.tf
locals.tf
network.tf
files.content:
module "vpc" {
  source  = "terraform-aws-modules/vpc/aws"
  version = "~> 5.0"

  name = local.name
  cidr = var.vpc_cidr

  azs             = local.azs
  public_subnets  = local.public_subnets
  private_subnets = local.private_subnets

  enable_nat_gateway     = true
  single_nat_gateway     = true
  one_nat_gateway_per_az = false

  enable_dns_hostnames = true
  enable_dns_support   = true

  public_subnet_tags = {
    "kubernetes.io/role/elb" = "1"
  }

  private_subnet_tags = {
    "kubernetes.io/role/internal-elb" = "1"
  }

  tags = local.tags
}

files.name: ecr.tf
eks.tf
files.content:
data "aws_eks_cluster_auth" "this" {
  name = module.eks.cluster_name
}

module "eks" {
  source  = "terraform-aws-modules/eks/aws"
  version = "~> 20.0"

  cluster_name    = local.name
  cluster_version = var.eks_cluster_version

  vpc_id     = module.vpc.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = module.vpc.private_subnets

  cluster_endpoint_public_access  = true
  cluster_endpoint_private_access = true

  enable_cluster_creator_admin_permissions = true

  eks_managed_node_groups = {
    default = {
      name            = "default"
      instance_types  = var.node_instance_types
      min_size        = var.node_min_size
      max_size        = var.node_max_size
      desired_size    = var.node_desired_size
      subnet_ids      = module.vpc.private_subnets
      capacity_type   = "ON_DEMAND"
      ami_type        = "AL2_x86_64"
      disk_size       = 30
    }
  }

  tags = local.tags
}

files.name: README.md
files.content:
# Terraform: StackFusion on AWS (EKS + ECR)

This Terraform config provisions:
- VPC (2 AZs, public/private subnets, single NAT)
- EKS cluster + managed node group
- ECR repository for the application image
- AWS Load Balancer Controller (via Helm + IRSA)
- Kubernetes Deployment/Service/Ingress for the Tomcat app
- (Optional) Jenkins controller on EC2 (disabled by default)

## Usage

```bash
cd ai_tf
terraform init
terraform validate
terraform plan
```

After apply, build and push your image to ECR and set `app_image` accordingly.

Notes:
- The provided app container in the repo exposes port 8080 in Dockerfile, but the Kubernetes manifest uses port 80.
  This Terraform keeps `app_container_port=80` to match the existing k8s manifest. Adjust if your image listens on 8080.
- Route53/ACM integration is stubbed; ALB is created by the controller.
